greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: From fourth root of the inverse of Riemann zeta function: form Dirichlet series Sum b(n)/n^x whose fourth power is 1/zeta; sequence gives numerator of b(n).
comment: Dirichlet g.f. of b(n) = a(n)/A256691(n) is (zeta (x))^(-1/4).
Denominator is the same as for Dirichlet g.f. (zeta(x))^(+1/4).
Formula holds for general Dirichlet g.f. zeta(x)^(-1/k) with k = 1, 2, ...
link: Wolfgang Hintze, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..500
formula: Then solve c(k,n) = mu(n) for b(m);
mathematica: sol = Solve[Join[{b[1] == 1}, eqs], Table[b[i], {i, 1, nn}], Reals];
results.author: _Wolfgang Hintze_, Apr 16 2015
